titles.title: A bill to provide for a program of the Department of Defense to commemorate the 75th anniversary of World War II.
75th Anniversary of World War II Commemoration Act
75th Anniversary of World War II Commemoration Act
75th Anniversary of World War II Commemoration Act
75th Anniversary of World War II Commemoration Act
75th Anniversary of World War II Commemoration Act

vote.text: Introduced in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Mr. Graves (MO) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on S. 3661.

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 370 - 0 (Roll no. 486).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Message on House action received in Senate and at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.
Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Senate agreed to the House amendment to S. 3661 by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

term.name: War crimes, genocide, crimes against humanity

bill.summary:
75th Anniversary of World War II Commemoration Act
This bill directs the Department of Defense to conduct a program to commemorate the 75th anniversary of World War II.
